backend/main.mo: Motoko actor implementing session management, scoreboard tracking, event logging (flags/points), team icon selection, and caption storage for a football broadcast application.
feature_evidence.json: Feature evidence report documenting two UI repositioning tasks: moving quarter control buttons to align with point controls, and relocating the quarter timer to the top-left video overlay.
frontend-file-summaries.txt: Pre-existing summaries of frontend files describing React components, hooks, pages, and layouts for a football broadcast/viewer application with camera, scoreboard, events, and captions.
frontend/index.css: Tailwind CSS configuration with OKLCH color system defining light/dark theme variables for football-themed UI including sidebar, charts, and destructive colors.
frontend/index.html: HTML entry point for 'Gridiron Live' application with root div and module script reference to main.tsx.
frontend/src/App.tsx: TanStack Router setup defining routes for landing, broadcaster, viewer join, and viewer watch pages, all wrapped in FootballLayout.
frontend/src/components/broadcast/Broadc: Toggle button component for broadcaster microphone control with loading, error, and retry states.
frontend/src/components/broadcast/Footba: Game controls card with Flag button that opens a dialog for team selection and reason input, with loading state handling for scoreboard initialization.
frontend/src/components/broadcast/Microp: Help component displaying microphone error messages (permission, not-found, not-supported) with retry button.
frontend/src/components/broadcast/Permis: Help component displaying camera permission error messages with retry functionality.
frontend/src/components/broadcast/Quarte: A card component that displays quarter timer controls with play/pause, reset, next quarter, and halftime toggle buttons. Shows the current phase and formatted time with conditional button states based on game phase and running status.
A simple overlay component that displays the current game phase and formatted time in the top-left corner with a semi-transparent black background.
frontend/src/components/broadcast/Scoreb: A comprehensive scoreboard control panel that allows updating team scores and offensive/defensive roles with increment/decrement buttons. Manages local state and syncs changes to the backend via mutation hooks.
frontend/src/components/broadcast/Sessio: A card component that displays the broadcast session code with a copy-to-clipboard button. Shows visual feedback when the code is successfully copied.
frontend/src/components/events/EventFeed: Displays a scrollable list of game events (flags and scores) with timestamps and icons. Shows a placeholder message when no events exist.
frontend/src/components/events/FlagAnnou: An animated overlay component that displays flag penalty announcements on either the left or right side of the screen with team name and reason.
frontend/src/components/events/LatestEve: A temporary overlay that appears at the top center of the screen to display the latest game event for 5 seconds with fade-in animation.
frontend/src/components/layout/FootballL: The main application layout wrapper with header (logo, title, social links), main content area, and footer with copyright and Caffeine.ai attribution.
frontend/src/components/scoreboard/Botto: An empty component file with no content.
frontend/src/components/scoreboard/OnCam: A bottom-aligned scoreboard overlay showing both teams' icons, names, scores, and offensive possession indicator with VillanSpoon branding.
frontend/src/components/scoreboard/Score: A reusable card wrapper component for scoreboard-related content with a title, optional icon, and styled border/backdrop.
frontend/src/components/system/Unsupport: An error state component that displays when the browser lacks required features (getUserMedia, WebRTC) with recommendations for supported browsers.
frontend/src/components/viewer/ViewerSub: A conditional overlay that displays live captions at the top of the viewer screen, with special handling for unavailable captions and empty text.
frontend/src/components/viewer/ViewerVid: React component that displays a live stream video player for viewers with overlays for waiting, live, ended, and error states, using the useViewerLiveStream hook to manage WebRTC connection.
frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts: React hook that creates and manages an authenticated or anonymous actor for backend communication using Internet Identity, invalidating dependent queries when the actor changes.
frontend/src/hooks/useBroadcasterSession: React hook that manages broadcaster session lifecycle (idle, starting, live, ending, ended), generating session codes and coordinating start/end mutations with team icon setup.
frontend/src/hooks/useBroadcastMediaStre: React hook that combines video and audio tracks into a single broadcast MediaStream, managing microphone enable/disable state and track lifecycle.
frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.t: React context provider and hook for Internet Identity authentication, managing login state, identity persistence, and delegation validation with configurable AuthClient options.
frontend/src/hooks/useMicrophone.ts: React hook that manages microphone access and audio stream capture with configurable quality settings, error handling for permissions/support, and start/stop/retry functionality.
frontend/src/hooks/useQuarterTimer.ts: React hook that implements a basketball game quarter timer with 6-minute quarters, halftime support, and controls for start/pause/reset/next quarter operations.
frontend/src/hooks/useQueries.ts: Defines React Query hooks for fetching session metadata, events, scoreboard, and flag events, plus mutations for starting/ending sessions, setting team icons, and adding events/flags/captions.
frontend/src/hooks/useSessionCode.ts: Provides a hook to manage session code state in both React state and localStorage, with methods to set and clear the code.
frontend/src/hooks/useSessionLifecycle.t: Determines session lifecycle state ('waiting', 'live', 'ended', 'unknown') based on metadata and loading status.
Wraps browser SpeechRecognition API to provide continuous speech-to-text transcription with start/stop controls and error handling.
frontend/src/hooks/useTimedFlagOverlay.t: Manages timed display of flag event overlays, showing the latest unseen flag for a configurable duration and tracking seen flags in sessionStorage.
frontend/src/hooks/useViewerLiveStream.t: Attempts to establish a WebRTC peer connection for viewing live video streams, but currently shows an error indicating backend signaling endpoints are not yet implemented.
frontend/src/index.css: Defines Tailwind CSS configuration with custom OKLCH color variables for light/dark themes, football field background image, and utility classes for scoreboard text and broadcast glow effects.
frontend/src/lib/teamIcons.ts: Exports team icon metadata (dolphin, bullfrog, fist, tornado) with image paths and provides helper functions to retrieve icon info and scoreboard team names.
frontend/src/main.tsx: Application entry point that sets up React Query, Internet Identity provider, and renders the root App component.
frontend/src/pages/BroadcasterPage.tsx: Main broadcaster interface managing session lifecycle, camera/microphone/speech controls, scoreboard/quarter/flag overlays, and event feed with real-time updates.
frontend/src/pages/LandingPage.tsx: Landing page component with two cards: one for starting a broadcast and one for watching a game by entering a session code.
frontend/src/pages/ViewerJoinPage.tsx: Viewer join page where users enter and validate a 6-character session code to watch a live game, with error handling and navigation.
frontend/src/pages/ViewerWatchPage.tsx: Main viewer page displaying live video with overlays (scoreboard, events, flags, subtitles), event feed sidebar, and subtitle toggle controls.
frontend/tailwind.config.js: Tailwind CSS configuration with custom color scheme using OKLCH, extended theme properties, animations, and plugin integrations.
project_state.json: Project metadata tracking architectural notes, existing features for repositioning quarter timer to top-left of video and moving quarter control buttons to point section controls area.
